<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/safestack/stacklayout/#a1f96a1519b9c38368a328cea96e449fb"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/safestack/stacklayout/#a1f96a1519b9c38368a328cea96e449fb">StackLayout::computeLayout</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Simple greedy algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this is replaced with something smarter, it must preserve the property</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that the first object is always at the offset 0 in the stack frame (for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// StackProtectorSlot), or handle stack protector in some other way.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Sort objects by size (largest first) to reduce fragmentation.</span></CodeLine>
